countryVisaSteps.title: Step 1: Book an Appointment
countryVisaSteps.description: Getting a South Korea visa application submission appointment is really hard. For a South Korea visa application from Bangladesh, booking an appointment beforehand is important. Applicants need to visit South Korea's appointment portal and provide the necessary information to book their appointment.

countryVisaSteps.title: Step 2: Gather Necessary Documents
countryVisaSteps.description: Collecting all the required documents is the next important step. Make sure to translate all the documents into English and notarize them before submitting them.

countryVisaSteps.title: Step 3: Fill Out The Application Form
countryVisaSteps.description: Once the appointment is booked, applicants can fill out their South Korea visa application form. They need to visit the South Korea Embassy in Bangladesh website to download their application form. Then, complete the application form carefully and print it. Remember, skipping any required information can cause visa rejection.

countryVisaSteps.title: Step 4: Visit The Embassy Personally
countryVisaSteps.description: The next phase is to submit your visa application along with the required documents. You need to visit the South Korea Embassy in person on the appointment day. Applicants need to pay their visa on the same day at the embassy.

countryVisaSteps.title: Step 5: Wait For Your Visa Decision
countryVisaSteps.description: When the process is done, wait for your visa decision. Applicants are required to collect their passports from the embassy after the visa decision is made.

countrySections.name: Time and Fees
countrySections.title: Processing Time And Fee For South Korea Visa From Bangladesh
countrySections.content:
South Korea visa fee for Bangladeshi starts with a short-term single entry visa and also has the option of multiple entry for both short and long term. South Korea’s visa fee costs between BDT 4400 to BDT 9885. The range of the fees can change at times as it depends on the international currency rate.

South Korea visa processing time for Bangladeshi typically takes 7 to 15 working days. The processing time can vary based on the complexity level of the applicant's documents.

countrySections.name: Decision and Appeal
countrySections.title: South Korea Visa Decision And Appeal: Process And Details
countrySections.content:
Bangladeshi applicants can appeal against the South Korean visa rejection within 7 working days of the visa decision. The appeal has to be filed in written form in English or Korean language. Applicants can file a second appeal if the first appeal decision comes out negative. The time frame for the second appeal is also 7 days from the decision of the first appeal.

Applicants can also reapply for their South Korea visa if the previous attempt gets rejected. In this case, applicants for all visa types must wait for 6 months to resubmit their South Korea visa application from Bangladesh. The previous visa fee is also not refundable.
